intro: Desmopsis maxonii, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branching. Desmopsis maxonii is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with deep roots and a slow growth rate.
